Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole's intentional walk of Rafael Devers backfired, leading to 7 runs scored by the Red Sox
The Red Sox went on to beat the Yankees 7-1, cutting New York's lead in the American League to 2 1/2 games over the Baltimore Orioles
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees had pregame discussions with Gerrit Cole and manager Aaron Boone to intentionally walk Rafael Devers with one out and no one on base
Cole had pregame discussions with Boone where they decided they would be'more aggressive' with walking Devers in certain situations
Post-Match Reflections: Gerrit Cole said he was 'bought into the plan going into it' but it was the 'wrong move' after the intentional walk
Aaron Boone said he didn't communicate the plan well enough and Cole was indecisive
Cole said the objective for the Yankees was to not let Devers beat them, but he needed to make better pitches
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rafael Devers entered the game 13-for-39 with eight home runs and 18 RBIs in 43 plate appearances against Gerrit Cole in his career
The Red Sox's third baseman was confused by the Yankees' decision not to pitch to him, but stopped short of believing he was hit on purpose
Others: The Red Sox were heated after the game about what transpired between Cole and Devers, particularly because of the third baseman's first at-bat of the game
Red Sox starter Brayan Bello said he felt Cole'showed a lot of weakness in that move' to intentionally walk Devers
